result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
22CF25, 22CF31 & 22CF77 Cases called @ 10:53 AM Defendant Tyler J. Wagner in court.  Attorney Danielle Marie Gorsuch in court for Tyler J. Wagner.  Attorney Dennis J Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Gorsuch advises that Judge Blader may have been the DA on some of the defendant's previous cases. The defendant waives any conflict with Judge Blader remaining on the cases. The Court addresses the defendant's motion to dismiss. No further argument by either party. The Court denies the motion to dismiss and denies the motion to strike the pleadings of the State. Argument by Atty Gorsuch. Argument by ADA Ryan. The Court affirms the denial of the motion to dismiss and strike the pleadings. The Court addresses the motion for joinder filed by the State. Argument by ADA Ryan. Argument by Atty Gorsuch. The Court grants the motion for joinder and will allow the State to file an information which includes all charges in 22CF25, 22CF31 & 22CF77.  Court addresses defense motion in limine, subject to State's 906.09 motion. Statement by Atty Gorsuch as to paragraph 5. Statement by ADA Ryan as to paragraph 5. The Court will allow the State to have a court officer. Statement by Atty Gorsuch regarding paragraph 9. No objection by State. Court grants defense motions 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 7, 8. The Court denies 5 & 9. The Court will hold in abeyance determination on 10. The Court addresses paragraph 10 in conjunction with the 906.09 motion filed by the State. Court makes statement and instructs defendant regarding impeachment-answer is yes, and correct number is 6.  Court further instructs defendant regarding answer and consequences of answer-Defendant states the instructions are understood. The Court addresses the State's Motion to Admit Statements. The Court grants the Motion to Admit Statement's. The Court will address any 906.09 motions regarding witnesses the day of trial.  Court addresses State motion in limine, save the 906.09 motion. No objection by Attorney Gorsuch. Court grants State's motions in limine. Ludwig colloquy addressed on the record. The parties advise the Court that an analyst will be needed for trial and are requesting two days for trial. The Court will schedule a STC to schedule the JT.
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:35 pm.

Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG Plea entered on all 5 counts. Motion for bond modification filed by Atty Gorsuch. Bond modification argument by Atty Gorsuch. Cross exam by Atty Gorsuch. Redirect by DA Leusink. Witness excused. Argument by Atty Gorsuch. The Court finds probable cause. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - reading waived. records.addlTxt:
22CF25 & 22CF31 Cases called @ 1:45 PM Defendant Tyler J. Wagner appeared in court, in custody, with Attorney Danielle Marie Gorsuch and Attorney Emma Blankschein. Attorney Matthew Leusink appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 22CF25 - Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Arraignment to be scheduled with the PH in 22CF31. Motion for bond modification filed by Atty Blankschein. Statement by DA Leusink. The Court declines to modify the bond.

22CF31 - Complaint stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment. Receipt admitted - reading waived. Defendant requests a PH be scheduled. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Gorsuch. Court orders $5000 Sig Bond. Recess at 1:59 for DE to talk with Attorney Gorsuch about the preliminary hearing. Case recalled @ 2:01 p.m. Same appearances. The Court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. PH/Arraignment Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
